One Piece: Heroines is a Japanese light novel series written by Jun Esaka and illustrated by Sayaka Suwa. It began publication under Shueisha 's Jump J-Books imprint in June 2021. The series is a female-centric spin-off of the One Piece manga series by Eiichiro Oda . An anime adaptation has been announced.

Written by Jun Esaka and illustrated by Sayaka Suwa, One Piece: Heroines began publication under Shueisha 's Jump J-Books light novel imprint on June 4, 2021. [ 1 ] Two volumes have been released as of March 4, 2024. [ 2 ]

In May 2024, Viz Media announced that they had licensed the series and would release the first volume in Q2 2025. [ 3 ]

An anime adaptation was announced during the "One Piece Day" event and livestream on August 10, 2025. It is directed by Haruka Kamatani, with Momoka Toyoda writing the script and Takashi Kojima designing the characters. [ 7 ] [ 8 ]
